title: Gym & Tonic: Fitness cafe brand site with membership + Tonic access pass

requirements.text: Create a small marketing website for the brand “Gym & Tonic” that clearly presents: (1) the gym concept, (2) the supported workout styles (weight training, calisthenics, rowing/cardio), (3) the holistic fitness outlook, and (4) the membership-inclusive full-time cafe access to the in-house cafe called “Tonic”. All user-facing text must be in English.

quotes: A fitness cafe called Gym & Tonic that caters to all forms of workouts including weight training, calisthenics, cardio-intensive activities like rowing, and a holistic outlook on fitness that incides oa membership-inclusive full-time access to the cafe known as 'Tonic.'

acceptanceCriteria: A visitor can navigate to sections/pages that describe: workout offerings (weights/calisthenics/rowing-cardio), holistic fitness positioning, and the “Tonic” cafe concept.
The site uses consistent brand naming: “Gym & Tonic” for the overall business and “Tonic” for the cafe.
All copy is in English and is readable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and an Account area that shows the signed-in user’s membership status and whether they have “Tonic” cafe access included. If the user is not signed in, the Account area must prompt them to sign in.

quotes: membership-inclusive full-time access to the cafe known as 'Tonic.'

acceptanceCriteria: A user can sign in via Internet Identity and see an Account page/section.
The Account view clearly displays a membership status (e.g., Active/Inactive) and a “Tonic Access” indicator (Included/Not included).
Signed-out users see a clear call-to-action to sign in.

requirements.text: Add a simple “Tonic Access Pass” view for signed-in members that can be used as a digital proof-of-access screen (showing the cafe name “Tonic”, the user identifier, membership state, and an “Access: Granted/Not granted” indicator).

quotes: full-time access to the cafe known as 'Tonic.'

acceptanceCriteria: For an active member with Tonic access, the pass shows “Access: Granted”.
For a non-member (or inactive member), the pass shows “Access: Not granted”.
The pass screen is usable on a phone-sized viewport without horizontal scrolling.

requirements.text: Create backend data models and APIs to store and retrieve a user’s membership status and Tonic cafe access entitlement keyed by the user’s Internet Identity principal. Include an admin-only method (restricted to a configured admin principal list) to set/update a user’s membership and Tonic access.

quotes: membership-inclusive full-time access to the cafe known as 'Tonic.'

acceptanceCriteria: Backend persists membership records keyed by principal and returns them to the authenticated caller.
Non-admin users cannot call admin-only mutation methods (calls are rejected/denied).
Frontend uses the backend API to display membership + Tonic entitlement in the Account and Pass views.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a modern fitness cafe brand (avoid blue/purple as primary colors). Define consistent typography, spacing, and UI patterns across all pages/sections.
acceptanceCriteria: A single, consistent theme is applied across the app (colors, typography, components).
Primary palette does not use blue/purple as the dominant brand color.
Pages/sections share consistent layout rhythm (headings, section spacing, buttons/links).

requirements.text: Add the generated static image assets to the frontend and use them in the marketing site (hero/branding) without routing images through the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
At least the hero image and logo are visible on the landing experience.
No backend endpoint is used to serve these static images.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional backend services).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose and use existing UI components instead.
Use Internet Identity only for authentication (no third-party auth providers).
nonGoals: Building workout tracking, class scheduling, bookings, payments, or e-commerce flows.
Real-time features (websockets/live chat) or external database integrations.

required: Minimal logo mark with text “Gym & Tonic” in a bold, modern style (gym-tonic-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero banner illustration/photo-collage style showing a gym+cafe vibe with weights/calisthenics/rowing hints (gym-tonic-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Small set of 4 monochrome icons: dumbbell, pull-up bar/rings, rowing machine, coffee cup (gym-tonic-icons.dim_512x512.png)
